revised_title: The Effect of Oxygenated Blood on the Production of Glycosuria
tldr: The author conducted experiments to understand the effect of oxygenated blood on the liver and the production of glycosuria. They discovered that injecting defibrinated arterial blood into the portal system of a dog led to a significant increase in sugar levels in the urine. This finding supports the idea that oxygenated blood plays a role in the transformation of amyloid substance into sugar in the liver.
